remarks: Vectors belonging to disjoint subgroups are uniquely determined by their sum.  Analogous to ~ opth , this theorem shows a way of representing a pair of vectors.  (Contributed by NM, 5-Jul-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 19-Apr-2016.)
statement:
subgdisj.p $e |- .+ = ( +g ` G ) $.
subgdisj.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
subgdisj.z $e |- Z = ( Cntz ` G ) $.
subgdisj.t $e |- ( ph -> T e. ( SubGrp ` G ) ) $.
subgdisj.u $e |- ( ph -> U e. ( SubGrp ` G ) ) $.
subgdisj.i $e |- ( ph -> ( T i^i U ) = { .0. } ) $.
subgdisj.s $e |- ( ph -> T C_ ( Z ` U ) ) $.
subgdisj.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. T ) $.
subgdisj.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. T ) $.
subgdisj.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. U ) $.
subgdisj.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. U ) $.
subgdisjb $p |- ( ph -> ( ( A .+ B ) = ( C .+ D ) <-> ( A = C /\ B = D ) ) ) $.
